meanings.sent1: She misreckoned the total cost of the groceries and ended up spending more than she planned.
meanings.sent2: He often misreckoned the time it would take to finish his homework.
meanings.sent3: The robot misreckoned the distance and bumped into the wall, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition misreckoned the situation, leading her to make a hasty decision.
meanings.sent5: The detective's misreckoned theory turned out to be the key to solving the case.

meanings.sent1: The coach misreckoned the opponent's strength and underestimated their skills.
meanings.sent2: She misreckoned his intentions and ended up misinterpreting his actions.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast misreckoned the amount of rain, leaving many unprepared for the storm.
meanings.sent4: His misreckoned perception of success led him to pursue the wrong career path.
meanings.sent5: The historian misreckoned the significance of the ancient artifact, only to later discover its true value.
